modules.description: This module provides functions to fold over UTF-8, UTF-16BE, and UTF-16LE encoded strings based on Unicode segmentation boundaries, and formatters that correctly handle Unicode grapheme clusters and line breaks when printing UTF-8 strings. It operates directly on OCaml strings containing encoded Unicode data, treating malformed sequences as replacement characters. Use cases include processing multilingual text with proper character boundary detection and formatting Unicode-rich strings in a terminal or document layout without breaking clusters or miscounting widths.

This module segments Unicode text into grapheme clusters, words, sentences, or line breaks according to Unicode standards. It processes text incrementally through stateful segmenters that consume individual characters and signal boundary positions. Use cases include text rendering, line wrapping, and natural language processing tasks requiring precise Unicode segmentation.
